description.value:
Since the dawn of time, the whistling wind, rushing rivers and calls of birds have inspired countless works of art. Some bards see beauty in the world around us, acting as emissaries to the powers of nature, and working with the land as their canvas. The College of Nature is less an organization than an ideal - to protect the wonder of the wild, and find joy in its splendor. Their commitment to harmony allows them to speak to animals, plants, and even elementals. When nature comes under attack, they call on those powers to protect it - and can unleash devastating natural disasters in defense.

Bards of the College of Nature might use any instrument, from paints, to flutes, to dance - anything that allows them to attune to the rhythms of the world. In Xen’drik, the Vulkoor, Qaltiar, and Na’qalla drow venerate and call upon the spirits of nature, while the Rimewalker druids of the Iceflow often speak with the giant animals of their home. In Khorvaire, the Greensingers of the Reaches combine druidic and bardic traditions to treat with the fey, while the gnomes of Lorghalan survive through their close friendship with elementals
